com.wingfoot.xml.schema.gen
Class SchemaConverterInstance

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.wingfoot.xml.schema.gen.SchemaConverterInstance
public class SchemaConverterInstance
extends java.lang.Object

Takes a set of SchemaHolders and converts them into Java objects. The current capability is limited to generating <complexTypes>

Constructor Detail

SchemaConverterInstance

public SchemaConverterInstance(SchemaHolder[] schemaHolderArray,
                               Options options)
Creates a of SchemaWriterInstance.
Parameters:
schemaHolderArray - array of SchemaHolder. The array contains all the SchemaHolder that are converted to Java representation. It is also possible that some components in a SchemaHolder use components defined in another SchemaHolder (ideally with different targetNamespace). In such a case both the SchemaHolders are present in the array.
Method Detail

getWrapperClassName

public java.lang.String getWrapperClassName(java.lang.String name)
Given a primitive class, returns a String with the fully qualified name of the wrapper class.
Parameters:
primitiveClass - Class that encapsulates the primitive class
Returns:
String with the fully qualified name of the corresponding wrapper class; null if the primitiveClass does not encapsulate a primitive type.

getQualifiedJavaType

public java.lang.String getQualifiedJavaType(Element element)
Overloaded method that takes an Element. The element has a type. Returns the fully qualfied Java type (ex. java.lang.Integer) for the Element.

getQualifiedJavaType

public java.lang.String getQualifiedJavaType(Type tr)
Takes a Type and returns back a Java type encapsulated by the Type. The String returned is of the format java.lang.String or com.wingfoot.Employee.

The array of SchemaHolder passed in the constructor is used to determine the

Parameters:
tr - the Type that has to be converted to a qualified name. The Type encapsulates one of XSDType, TypeReference, SimpleType or ComplexType.
Returns:
String the fully qualified Java type; returns java.lang.Object if an unsupported type is detected.

toJava

public SerializedHolder[] toJava()
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 JavaHolderException
Converts to Java each SchemaHolder in the array of SchemaHolders (passed in the constructor).

The only component of interest is <complexType> that is converted to a JavaBean.

Returns:
SerializedHolder[] array that contains the byte representation of all the necessary Java Beans; returns null if no Java Beans are created from the SchemaHolders.

getTypeMap

public java.util.Vector getTypeMap()
Returns a Vector of type maps. A type map is a association between a ComplexType and the corresponding Java object generated.

Each element of the Vector is a String[]. The String[] contains :

  • 0 - complexType namespace.
  • 1 - complexType name.
  • 2 - fully qualified class name.
    Returns:
    Vector of type maps.
